# Pricing and Risk Management

Pricing a European Option in the Black Scholes Framework. According to the BSM
a european option can be expressed as follows:

**_European Call Option Price_**
$$
\begin{columns}
  \begin{column}
    \text{European Call Price} \enspace
   C_{bs}(S, K, r, T, \sigma, d) = S e^{-d, T} N(d_{1}) - Ke^{-r, T} N(d_{2})
  \end{column}
\end{columns}
$$

**_European Put Option Price_**
$$
\begin{columns}
  \begin{column}
    \text{European Put Price} \enspace
   P_{bs}(S, K, r, T, \sigma, d) = Ke^{-r, T} N(-d_{2}) - S e^{-d, T} N(-d_{1})
  \end{column}
\end{columns}
$$
Where:
- $ d_{1} = \frac{\ln\left(\frac{S}{K}\right) + \left(r-q+\frac{\sigma^{2}}{2}\right)T}{\sigma\sqrt{T}} $
- $ d_{2} = d_{1} - \sigma\sqrt{T}$
And:
- $S$ is the underlying spot price
- $K$ is the strike price
- $r$ is the risk free rate
- $T$ is the tiime to maturity
- $\sigma$ is the implied volatility of the underlying
- $d$ is the implied dividend of the underlying
